description: Alteration of roof from hip to gable at both ends; rear roof extension (involving conversion of roofspace to habitable use) and installation of three rooflights to front; and conversion of dwelling house into 4 self contanied flats (1 x 1 bed; 2 x 2 bed & 1 x 3 bed) with private / communal amenity and refuse bin.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). In accordance with the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings, ref: 02 rev B and 03 rev A, received on 19/11/2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: In the interest of proper planning and to ensure that the development is carried out in accordance with the submitted details. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the original dwelling house and surrounding area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Development (Core) Strategy polices 1.1 and 1.2; and policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan 2011. | The proposed subdivision of the rear garden as shown on approved plan 02 rev B, shall be laid out and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To provide adequate garden amenity space in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5, of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 13 - Garden Space. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 02 rev B, received on 19/11/2012 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON:  To ensure there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the third floor flat shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with London Plan 2011 policy 6.13. and policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004/DCLG Direction 2007. | Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, written details and drawings for the provision of at least 4 secure cycle parking spaces, designed in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: In order to ensure that satisfactory facilities are available for the parking of bicycles on the site in pursuance of policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Details of refuse storage (both internal and external) shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Detail of which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with policy 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including (as appropriate), the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels. The details shall also include the proposed noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided and also mitigation of vibration. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure that the future occupiers are suitably protected from road traffic noise so that a suitable living environment is maintained, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (July 2011) and policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration.
